brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate topographic features of the posterior pole of the
      eye in normal subjects as well as in subjects with diabetes mellitus but without diabetic
      retinopathy (DR) using optical coherence tomography (OCT).  The investigators proposal is a
      novel study to determine retinal volume of normal and diabetic subjects without DR.
      Specifically, the investigators will establish a standardized reference range for retinal
      thickness and volume that will provide standards for OCT analysis of different clinical
      trials for retinal diseases.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Retina of Subjects Without Diabetes Mellitus and Subjects With Diabetes Mellitus Without Diabetic Retinopathy Using Optical Coherence Tomography

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy retinas

          -  Willingness to sign informed consent to have OCT images taken.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  No macular pathology

          -  No Diabetes

intervention.description: Images taken to determine thickness values in the retina
intervention.intervention_name: OCT Imaging both Normal and diabetic groups

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Retina of Subjects Without Diabetes Mellitus and Subjects With Diabetes Mellitus Without Diabetic Retinopathy Using Optical Coherence Tomography

primary_outcome.description: Normative retinal thickness data for comparison
primary_outcome.measure: Normative retinal thickness data for comparison

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
